item.description:
For our second meeting in our Spring Pragmatism series we will look at William James' The Meaning of Truth. William James presented his Pragmatic Theory of Truth in a series of  lectures from 1907, titled Pragmatism. This idea proved to be controversial and so James followed up with The Meaning of Truth (1909), a collection of essays,  to further clarify, explain and defend his pragmatic notion of truth.


The full text is available at Project Gutenberg:
http://www.gutenberg.org/ebooks/5117

It is also available on Kindle:
http://www.amazon.com/Pragmatism-Meaning-Truth-Works-William/dp/1603864148
